thread.title: K-State goes 7-0 on last day of tourney
thread.title_full: K-State goes 7-0 on last day of tourney

title: K-State goes 7-0 on last day of tourney
text:
K-State goes 7-0 on last day of tourney By The Mercury October 12, 2015 
DALLAS — The Kansas State women’s tennis team went undefeated on the final day of the SMU Fall Tournament, earning five singles wins and two doubles victories to cap the weekend with a 12-9 record. 
Wildcats’ head coach Danielle Steinberg was pleased with the way her team ended the weekend. 
“Today we got a little tougher as a team,” Steinberg said. “It was the third day of the tournament, and everyone had tough battles yesterday, but we all showed a high level of maturity in how we competed.” 
After a tough semifinal loss Saturday, Carolina Costamagna defeated UTA’s Elizabeth Thomas (4-6, 7-5, 7-5) in her second straight three-set match. 
“Caro had another third-set battle, but for the first time this year, she was able to stick to the game plan and keep her focus throughout the match which is huge for her,“ Steinberg said. 
Similar to Costamagna, Livia Cirnu bounced back from a semifinal loss in her draw by defeating Dasha Sharapova of SMU (7-5, 6-3) to pick up third-place in the Red Singles. The victory was Cirnu’s third in her last four matches. 
Millie Stretton and Maria Panaite each ended the weekend winning two straight matches, with Stretton defeating Mada Marianovic of Abilene Christian (6-4, 6-3) in the Black draw consolation final and Panaite downing Abilene Christian’s Alba Perny (6-4, 6-0) in the SMU draw consolation final. 
Meanwhile, Iva Bago beat UTEP’s Matilda Tench (6-4, 6-2) in an extra match of the Blue Singles draw. This was one of two wins for Bago on the day, as she and Stretton took down Erin Walker and Kaysie Harmsdorf from Abilene Christian 6-2 in the Red Doubles draw. 
Also competing for K-State in doubles, Costamagna and Cirnu beat Louisiana Tech’s Alexandra Starkova and Zoe Chen 6-2 to earn their second win as doubles partners. 
“Liv and Iva both bounced back from yesterday’s tough losses to play great doubles and singles, while Millie and Maria both continued to show great improvements in their singles game,” Steinberg said. 
“Overall, we definitely improved as a team this weekend.” 
Bago and Costamagna will be joined by Sara Castellano and Ana Garcia Navas at the ITA Central Regional Championships Oct. 15-18 at the Greenwood Tennis Center in Stillwater, Okla.
